In the EJB test case:

WTP Tutorials - Building a Simple EJB Application 
(http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/community/tutorials/ejbtutorial/buildingejbs.html)

There is no problem with creating a DBCS EJB project and a DBCS named enterprise bean in it. But when I creat another dynamic web project with a JSP file, in which the JSP is used to connect to the enterprise bean, it seems there is a big problem with making the web project dependent on the EJB JARs. When I right click on the web project and choose Properties -> J2EE Module Dependencies, a error message continously pops out. If I close the message, the same message pops out again. And when I finally manage to close the error message, the eclipse crashes. Please refer to the error log attached to this bug.

Testing Environment:
RHEL 4 update 2 (Traditional Chinese)
JDK: IBM JDK 1.5.0
JBOSS: JBOSS 4.0.4RC1
XDoclet 1.2.3
IES Build: I20060401

Created an attachment (id=37607)
Error log when this problem happens

You ultimately hit NPEs in the J2EEDependenciesPage (note: checks for most of those NPEs have been added to CVS and I'm going to fix the rest in the context of https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=134579), however, the trigger in this case appears to be a sequence of EJB-specific exceptions beginning with:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2006-04-04 18:00:30.869
!MESSAGE Array index out of range: -1
!STACK 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: Array index out of range: -1
	at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.ejb.annotations.internal.xdoclet.ui.XDocletPreferencePage.validateCurrentPreferences(XDocletPreferencePage.java:223)
	at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.ejb.annotations.internal.xdoclet.ui.XDocletPreferencePage$1.modifyText(XDocletPreferencePage.java:181)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java:196)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)
...

This preference exception in this page was fixed.  However, I do not think it  is the cause of the problem.

I would suggest retesting it with RC4 and openning the bug again if the problem remains

This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP resolved bugs from the 1.0.x and 1.5.0 timeframe.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

Thanks, John Lanuti
